meanings.definition: Remove water from (a substance or material)
meanings.sent1: I am dehydrating the fruits to make them last longer.
meanings.sent2: The sun is dehydrating the wet clothes hanging on the line.
meanings.sent3: The dehydrating process turned the juicy grapes into raisins.
meanings.sent4: The desert air was dehydrating the soil, making it hard and cracked.
meanings.sent5: She learned that dehydrating food preserves it for future use.

meanings.definition: Cause (a person or animal) to lose a large amount of water from the body
meanings.sent1: Running a marathon without water can dehydrate your body.
meanings.sent2: The hot weather is dehydrating the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The intense workout session left him dehydrating and exhausted.
meanings.sent4: The long hike in the sun was dehydrating the hikers quickly.
meanings.sent5: Remember to drink water to prevent dehydrating during exercise.
